newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares rise over two pct, seen buoyant.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares rise over two pct, seen buoyant.

text.p: Slovenian shares rose 2.13 percent on Thursday and traders said the rise was due to general optimism supported by approaching comeback of foreign buyers.

"Domestic investors finally woke up, obviously expectation of fresh foreign money is heating up -- the moderate rise is likely to continue for a few weeks," said Nena Jarc, a trader at Nova Ljubljanska Banka.
* The SBI index rose 28.18 points to 1,353.29.
* Overall 17 shares rose, one fell and one was flat, while nine were untraded.

* Petrol trader Petrol was the top gainer and the most active share, jumping 5.25 percent to 19,050 tolars on volume of 1,900 shares. A trader forecast a further rise for Petrol, which only made its debut on the bourse on Monday. Petrol had been significantly undervalued, but could soon reach 20,000 tolars, he said. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
